text: Complete the puzzle by filling in the missing characters.
Remember, the topic can sometimes help you along.
Start by doing what’s necessary; then do what’s possible; and suddenly you are doing the impossible.
author: Francis of Assisi

text: My mission in life is not merely to survive, but to thrive; and to do so with some passion, some compassion, some humor, and some style.
author: Maya Angelou

text: The more of your private life you put into the public domain, the smaller your private life becomes.
author: Kevin McCloud

text: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
author: Confucius

text: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.
author: Buddha

text: Life isn’t about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: The most important thing is to enjoy your life — to be happy — it’s all that matters.
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: We do not remember days, we remember moments.
author: Cesare Pavese

text: In the end, it’s not the years in your life that count. It’s the life in your years.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Nothing is impossible, the word itself says “I’m possible”!
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: The best preparation for tomorrow is doing your best today.
author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

text: Put your heart, mind, and soul into even your smallest acts. This is the secret of success.
author: Swami Sivananda

text: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched — they must be felt with the heart.
author: Helen Keller

text: Change your thoughts and you change your world.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

text: I can’t change the direction of the wind, but I can adjust my sails to always reach my destination.
author: Jimmy Dean

text: What we think, we become.
author: Buddha

text: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.
author: Aristotle Onassis

text: Believe you can and you’re halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Health is the greatest gift, contentment the greatest wealth, faithfulness the best relationship.
author: Buddha

text: A flower cannot blossom without sunshine, and man cannot live without love.
author: Max Muller

text: We waste time looking for the perfect lover, instead of creating the perfect love.
author: Tom Robbins

text: ’Tis better to have loved and lost than never to have loved at all.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

text: There can be no deep disappointment where there is not deep love.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

text: We’re born alone, we live alone, we die alone. Only through our love and friendship can we create the illusion for the moment that we’re not alone.
author: Orson Welles

text: Love is when the other person’s happiness is more important than your own.
author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

text: Let us always meet each other with smile, for the smile is the beginning of love.
author: Mother Teresa

text: Kindness in words creates confidence. Kindness in thinking creates profoundness. Kindness in giving creates love.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Sometimes the heart sees what is invisible to the eye.
author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

text: I have found the paradox, that if you love until it hurts, there can be no more hurt, only more love.
author: Mother Teresa

text: Where there is love there is life.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: I have decided to stick with love. Hate is too great a burden to bear.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

text: Love is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies.
author: Aristotle

text: The sweetest of all sounds is that of the voice of the woman we love.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

text: Keep love in your heart. A life without it is like a sunless garden when the flowers are dead.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Always remember that you are absolutely unique. Just like everyone else.
author: Margaret Mead

text: People who think they know everything are a great annoyance to those of us who do.
author: Isaac Asimov

text: No man has a good enough memory to be a successful liar.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: I can resist everything except temptation.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Go to Heaven for the climate, Hell for the company.
author: Mark Twain

text: I’m sorry, if you were right, I’d agree with you.
author: Robin Williams

text: Behind every great man is a woman rolling her eyes.
author: Jim Carrey

text: I love deadlines. I like the whooshing sound they make as they fly by.
author: Douglas Adams

text: Laziness is nothing more than the habit of resting before you get tired.
author: Jules Renard

text: Weather forecast for tonight: dark.
author: George Carlin

text: All generalizations are false, including this one.
author: Mark Twain

text: It’s amazing that the amount of news that happens in the world every day always just exactly fits the newspaper.
author: Jerry Seinfeld

text: I refuse to join any club that would have me as a member.
author: Groucho Marx

text: The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it.
author: Terry Pratchett

text: Why do they call it rush hour when nothing moves?
author: Robin Williams

text: Mistakes are always forgivable, if one has the courage to admit them.
author: Bruce Lee

text: When you forgive, you in no way change the past — but you sure do change the future.
author: Bernard Meltzer

text: Forgive, forget. Bear with the faults of others as you would have them bear with yours.
author: Phillips Brooks

text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful.
author: Albert Schweitzer

text: Try not to become a man of success, but rather try to become a man of value.
author: Albert Einstein

text: However difficult life may seem, there is always something you can do and succeed at.
author: Stephen Hawking

text: All you need in this life is ignorance and confidence, and then success is sure.
author: Mark Twain

text: Happiness lies in the joy of achievement and the thrill of creative effort.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: Let me tell you the secret that has led me to my goal. My strength lies solely in my tenacity.
author: Louis Pasteur

text: It’s the steady, quiet, plodding ones who win in the lifelong race.
author: Robert W. Service

text: Happiness is having a large, loving, caring, close-knit family in another city.
author: George Burns

text: A pessimist is a person who has had to listen to too many optimists.
author: Don Marquis

text: If men knew how women pass the time when they are alone, they’d never marry.
author: O. Henry

text: Never have more children than you have car windows.
author: Erma Bombeck

text: It is easy for me to love myself, but for ladies to do it is another question altogether.
author: Johnny Vegas

text: The reports of my death have been greatly exaggerated.
author: Mark Twain

text: What contemptible scoundrel has stolen the cork to my lunch?
author: W. Clement Stone

text: Prejudice is a great time saver. You can form opinions without having to get the facts.
author: E. B. White

text: Rice is great if you’re really hungry and want to eat two thousand of something.
author: Mitch Hedberg

text: If I had nine of my fingers missing I wouldn’t type any slower.
author: Mitch Hedberg

text: I don’t have a girlfriend. But I do know a woman who’d be mad at me for saying that.
author: Mitch Hedberg

text: When someone hands you a flyer, it’s like they’re saying here you throw this away.
author: Mitch Hedberg

text: When you look at me, when you think of me, I am in paradise.
author: William Makepeace Thackeray

text: True love stories never have endings.
author: Richard Bach

text: A tramp, a gentleman, a poet, a dreamer, a lonely fellow, always hopeful of romance and adventure.
author: Charlie Chaplin

text: From a small seed a mighty trunk may grow.
author: Aeschylus

text: The things that we love tell us what we are.
author: Thomas Aquinas

text: Your big opportunity may be right where you are now.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: Happiness resides not in possessions, and not in gold, happiness dwells in the soul.
author: Democritus

text: Don’t judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

text: What great thing would you attempt if you knew you could not fail?
author: Robert H. Schuller

text: What lies behind you and what lies in front of you, pales in comparison to what lies inside of you.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: It is always the simple that produces the marvelous.
author: Amelia Barr

text: Do your little bit of good where you are; it’s those little bits of good put together that overwhelm the world.
author: Desmond Tutu

text: The world is full of magical things patiently waiting for our wits to grow sharper.
author: Bertrand Russell

text: All you need is the plan, the road map, and the courage to press on to your destination.
author: Earl Nightingale

text: Whoever is happy will make others happy too.
author: Anne Frank

text: Try to be like the turtle — at ease in your own shell.
author: Bill Copeland

text: Your heart is full of fertile seeds, waiting to sprout.
author: Morihei Ueshiba

text: Of all things visible, the highest is the heaven of the fixed stars.
author: Nicolaus Copernicus

text: Memories of our lives, of our works and our deeds will continue in others.
author: Rosa Parks

text: Wonder rather than doubt is the root of all knowledge.
author: Abraham Joshua Heschel

text: Love is a fruit in season at all times, and within reach of every hand.
author: Mother Teresa

text: Let us make our future now, and let us make our dreams tomorrow’s reality.
author: Malala Yousafzai

text: The power of imagination makes us infinite.
author: John Muir

text: If we did all the things we are capable of, we would literally astound ourselves.
author: Thomas A. Edison

text: It is not in the stars to hold our destiny but in ourselves.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Shoot for the moon and if you miss you will still be among the stars.
author: Les Brown

text: The Milky Way is nothing else but a mass of innumerable stars planted together in clusters.
author: Galileo Galilei

text: In questions of science, the authority of a thousand is not worth the humble reasoning of a single individual.
author: Galileo Galilei

text: Measure what is measurable, and make measurable what is not so.
author: Galileo Galilei

text: Only two things are infinite, the universe and human stupidity, and I’m not sure about the former.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Science is a way of thinking much more than it is a body of knowledge.
author: Carl Sagan

text: Imagination will often carry us to worlds that never were, but without it we go nowhere.
author: Carl Sagan

text: I am often amazed at how much more capability and enthusiasm for science there is among elementary school youngsters than among college students.
author: Carl Sagan

text: Our species needs, and deserves, a citizenry with minds wide awake and a basic understanding of how the world works.
author: Carl Sagan

text: The universe seems neither benign nor hostile, merely indifferent.
author: Carl Sagan

text: We’ve arranged a civilization in which most crucial elements profoundly depend on science and technology.
author: Carl Sagan

text: The science of today is the technology of tomorrow.
author: Edward Teller

text: Science is simply common sense at its best, that is, rigidly accurate in observation, and merciless to fallacy in logic.
author: Thomas Huxley

text: The most exciting phrase to hear in science, the one that heralds new discoveries, is not “Eureka!” but “That’s funny…”
author: Isaac Asimov

text: Science is not only a disciple of reason but, also, one of romance and passion.
author: Stephen Hawking

text: By denying scientific principles, one may maintain any paradox.
author: Galileo Galilei

text: Together let us explore the stars, conquer the deserts, eradicate disease, tap the ocean depths, and encourage the arts and commerce.
author: John F. Kennedy

text: Problems are not stop signs, they are guidelines.
author: Robert H. Schuller

text: In order to succeed, we must first believe that we can.
author: Nikos Kazantzakis

text: If you can dream it, you can do it.
author: Walt Disney

text: Good, better, best. Never let it rest. ’Til your good is better and your better is best.
author: St. Jerome

text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
author: Confucius

text: Always do your best. What you plant now, you will harvest later.
author: Og Mandino

text: It always seems impossible until it’s done.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: Failure will never overtake me if my determination to succeed is strong enough.
author: Og Mandino

text: Don’t watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
author: Sam Levenson

text: Keep your eyes on the stars, and your feet on the ground.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: A creative man is motivated by the desire to achieve, not by the desire to beat others.
author: Ayn Rand

text: Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn’t do than by the ones you did do.
author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.

text: There is some good in this world, and it’s worth fighting for.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Not all those who wander are lost.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given to us.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Well-behaved women seldom make history.
author: Laurel Thatcher Ulrich

text: It is better to be hated for what you are than to be loved for what you are not.
author: André Gide

text: Every human life is worth the same, and worth saving.
author: J.K. Rowling

text: It is our choices that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.
author: J.K. Rowling

text: We must all face the choice between what is right and what is easy.
author: J.K. Rowling

text: Get busy living, or get busy dying.
author: Stephen King

text: The goal isn’t to live forever, the goal is to create something that will.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

text: It’s only after we’ve lost everything that we’re free to do anything.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

text: Travel far enough, you meet yourself.
author: David Mitchell

text: None of us really changes over time. We only become more fully what we are.
author: Anne Rice

text: Most people are nice when you finally see them.
author: Harper Lee

text: All endings are also beginnings. We just don’t know it at the time.
author: Mitch Albom

text: When someone leaves, it’s because someone else is about to arrive.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: Even a stopped clock is right twice a day.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: When you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you to achieve it.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: It’s no use going back to yesterday, because I was a different person then.
author: Lewis Carroll

text: The only limits for tomorrow are the doubts we have today.
author: Pittacus Lore

text: If we wait until we’re ready, we’ll be waiting for the rest of our lives.
author: Lemony Snicket

text: I don’t want to die without any scars.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

text: Fear doesn’t shut you down; it wakes you up.
author: Veronica Roth

text: When you are imagining, you might as well imagine something worth while.
author: Lucy Maud Montgomery

text: The worst enemy to creativity is self-doubt.
author: Sylvia Plath

text: Yes: I am a dreamer. For a dreamer is one who can only find his way by moonlight, and his punishment is that he sees the dawn before the rest of the world.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: I dream. Sometimes I think that’s the only right thing to do.
author: Haruki Murakami

text: Pain is inevitable. Suffering is optional.
author: Haruki Murakami

text: If I got rid of my demons, I’d lose my angels.
author: Tennessee Williams

text: It is sometimes an appropriate response to reality to go insane.
author: Philip K. Dick

text: If you’re making mistakes it means you’re out there doing something.
author: Neil Gaiman

text: If my life is going to mean anything, I have to live it myself.
author: Rick Riordan

text: Art enables us to find ourselves and lose ourselves at the same time.
author: Thomas Merton

text: If you don’t imagine, nothing ever happens at all.
author: John Green

text: Everything is possible. The impossible just takes longer.
author: Dan Brown

text: Above all, don’t lie to yourself.
author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

text: Some infinities are bigger than other infinities.
author: John Green

text: So many things are possible just as long as you don’t know they’re impossible.
author: Norton Juster

text: You never know what worse luck your bad luck has saved you from.
author: Cormac McCarthy

text: Nothing that’s worthwhile is ever easy.
author: Nicholas Sparks

text: Time you enjoy wasting is not wasted time.
author: Marthe Troly-Curtin

text: It is never too late to be wise.
author: Daniel Defoe

text: Appear weak when you are strong, and strong when you are weak.
author: Sun Tzu

text: One day I will find the right words, and they will be simple.
author: Jack Kerouac

text: Anything worth dying for is certainly worth living for.
author: Joseph Heller

text: The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.
author: Lao Tzu

text: I have just three things to teach: simplicity, patience, compassion. These three are your greatest treasures.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Knowing others is wisdom, knowing yourself is enlightenment.
author: Lao Tzu

text: It’s not what you look at that matters, it’s what you see.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Whatever you do in life, surround yourself with smart people who’ll argue with you.
author: John Wooden

text: We are made wise not by the recollection of our past, but by the responsibility for our future.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: A good head and a good heart are always a formidable combination.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: Socrates

text: Work like you don’t need the money. Love like you’ve never been hurt. Dance like nobody’s watching.
author: Satchel Paige

text: It’s the little details that are vital. Little things make big things happen.
author: John Wooden

text: The greater danger for most of us lies not in setting our aim too high and falling short; but in setting our aim too low, and achieving our mark.
author: Michelangelo

text: If you don’t know where you are going, any road will get you there.
author: Lewis Carroll

text: Frankly, my dear, I don’t give a damn.
author: Gone With the Wind

text: I’m gonna make him an offer he can’t refuse.
author: The Godfather

text: You don’t understand! I coulda had class. I coulda been a contender. I could’ve been somebody, instead of a bum, which is what I am.
author: On the Waterfront

text: Toto, I’ve a feeling we’re not in Kansas anymore.
author: The Wizard of Oz

text: Fasten your seatbelts. It’s going to be a bumpy night.
author: All About Eve

text: What we’ve got here is failure to communicate.
author: Cool Hand Luke

text: I love the smell of napalm in the morning.
author: Apocalypse Now

text: Love means never having to say you’re sorry.
author: Love Story

text: The stuff that dreams are made of.
author: The Maltese Falcon

text: I’m as mad as hell, and I’m not going to take this anymore!
author: Network

text: Louis, I think this is the beginning of a beautiful friendship.
author: Casablanca

text: A census taker once tried to test me. I ate his liver with some fava beans and a nice Chianti.
author: The Silence of the Lambs

text: I am big! It’s the pictures that got small.
author: Sunset Blvd.

text: Why don’t you come up sometime and see me?
author: She Done Him Wrong

text: You know how to whistle, don’t you, Steve? You just put your lips together and blow.
author: To Have and Have Not

text: Badges? We ain’t got no badges! We don’t need no badges! I don’t have to show you any stinking badges!
author: The Treasure of the Sierra Madre

text: Today, I consider myself the luckiest man on the face of the earth.
author: The Pride of the Yankees

text: My mama always said life was like a box of chocolates. You never know what you’re gonna get.
author: Forrest Gump

text: Oh, Jerry, don’t let’s ask for the moon. We have the stars.
author: Now, Voyager

text: You’ve got to ask yourself one question: “Do I feel lucky?” Well, do ya, punk?
author: Dirty Harry

text: One morning I shot an elephant in my pajamas. How he got in my pajamas, I don’t know.
author: Animal Crackers

text: Greed, for lack of a better word, is good.
author: Wall Street

text: Keep your friends close, but your enemies closer.
author: The Godfather II

text: As God is my witness, I’ll never be hungry again.
author: Gone With the Wind

text: Well, here’s another nice mess you’ve gotten me into!
author: Sons of the Desert

text: Mrs. Robinson, you’re trying to seduce me. Aren’t you?
author: The Graduate

text: Gentlemen, you can’t fight in here! This is the War Room!
author: Dr. Strangelove

text: Take your stinking paws off me, you damned dirty ape.
author: Planet of the Apes

text: Of all the gin joints in all the towns in all the world, she walks into mine.
author: Casablanca

text: Wait a minute, wait a minute. You ain’t heard nothin’ yet!
author: The Jazz Singer

text: Listen to them. Children of the night. What music they make.
author: Dracula

text: Oh, no, it wasn’t the airplanes. It was Beauty killed the Beast.
author: King Kong

text: Sawyer, you’re going out a youngster, but you’ve got to come back a star!
author: 42nd Street

text: Listen to me, mister. You’re my knight in shining armor. Don’t you forget it. You’re going to get back on that horse, and I’m going to be right behind you, holding on tight, and away we’re gonna go, go, go!
author: On Golden Pond

text: Tell ’em to go out there with all they got and win just one for the Gipper.
author: Knute Rockne All American

text: Life is a banquet, and most poor suckers are starving to death!
author: Auntie Mame

text: My mother thanks you. My father thanks you. My sister thanks you. And I thank you.
author: Yankee Doodle Dandy

text: The secret to happiness is burying all your true feelings and living a life of bland compromise.
author: Lois Griffin, Family Guy

text: My days in college were so exciting. This one time, the national guard came and shot some of my friends.
author: Lois Griffin, Family Guy

text: Kids, your grandfather’s ears are not gross and they are certainly not an enchanted forest.
author: Lois Griffin, Family Guy

text: So, is there any tread left on the tires? Or at this point would it be like throwing a hot dog down a hallway?
author: Stewie Griffin, Family Guy

text: Hello, mother. I come bearing a gift. I’ll give you a hint. It’s in my diaper and it’s not a toaster.
author: Stewie Griffin, Family Guy

text: I’ve got an idea — an idea so smart that my head would explode if I even began to know what I’m talking about.
author: Peter Griffin, Family Guy

text: I had such a crush on her. Until I met you Lois. You’re my silver medal.
author: Peter Griffin, Family Guy

text: Joe, I’ve had new neighbors before, but none of them were half the man you are. Since you’re half a man already, that splits them into some kind of fraction I can’t even measure.
author: Peter Griffin, Family Guy

text: Sorry Meg. Daddy loves ya, but Daddy also loves Star Trek, and in all fairness, Star Trek was here first.
author: Peter Griffin, Family Guy

text: Hey, Peter, it’s seven o’clock and you’ve still got your pants on. What’s the occassion?
author: Brian Griffin, Family Guy

text: If dogs aren’t supposed to eat dental floss out of the trash, why did they make it mint flavored?
author: Brian Griffin, Family Guy

text: If you’re walking down the right path and you’re willing to keep walking, eventually you’ll make progress.
author: Barack Obama

text: My fellow Americans, we are and always will be a nation of immigrants. We were strangers once, too.
author: Barack Obama

text: Money is not the only answer, but it makes a difference.
author: Barack Obama

text: We want everybody to act like adults, quit playing games, realize that it’s not just my way or the highway.
author: Barack Obama

text: That’s the good thing about being president, I can do whatever I want.
author: Barack Obama

text: We have real enemies in the world. These enemies must be found. They must be pursued and they must be defeated.
author: Barack Obama

text: Anyone who is capable of getting themselves made President should on no account be allowed to do the job.
author: Douglas Adams

text: If it doesn’t matter who wins or loses, then why do they keep score?
author: Vince Lombardi

text: The pleasures of love are always in proportion to our fears.
author: Stendhal

text: In the world of words, the imagination is one of the forces of nature.
author: Wallace Stevens

text: Success is simply a matter of luck. Ask any failure.
author: Earl Wilson

text: Laughter is the sun that drives winter from the human face.
author: Victor Hugo

text: The better I get to know men, the more I find myself loving dogs.
author: Charles de Gaulle

text: Love him and let him love you. Do you think anything else under heaven really matters?
author: James A. Baldwin

text: About the time we can make the ends meet, somebody moves the ends.
author: Herbert Hoover

text: How beautiful the leaves grow old. How full of light and color are their last days.
author: John Burroughs

text: I’d rather have roses on my table than diamonds on my neck.
author: Emma Goldman

text: One of the most beautiful qualities of true friendship is to understand and to be understood.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

text: I know who I am. I am not perfect. I’m not the most beautiful woman in the world. But I’m one of them.
author: Mary J. Blige

text: For beautiful eyes, look for the good in others; for beautiful lips, speak only words of kindness; and for poise, walk with the knowledge that you are never alone.
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: Beauty is when you can appreciate yourself. When you love yourself, that’s when you’re most beautiful.
author: Zoe Kravitz

text: I didn’t attend the funeral, but I sent a nice letter saying I approved of it.
author: Mark Twain

text: We are all born for love. It is the principle of existence, and its only end.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

text: Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: There is nothing like returning to a place that remains unchanged to find the ways in which you yourself have altered.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it. The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: As long as poverty, injustice and gross inequality persist in our world, none of us can truly rest.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: It is better to lead from behind and to put others in front, especially when you celebrate victory when nice things occur. You take the front line when there is danger. Then people will appreciate your leadership.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: For to be free is not merely to cast off one’s chains, but to live in a way that respects and enhances the freedom of others.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: There is no passion to be found playing small — in settling for a life that is less than the one you are capable of living.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: When I admire the wonders of a sunset or the beauty of the moon, my soul expands in the worship of the creator.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: You must not lose faith in humanity. Humanity is an ocean; if a few drops of the ocean are dirty, the ocean does not become dirty.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Anger is the enemy of non-violence and pride is a monster that swallows it up.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Strength does not come from physical capacity. It comes from an indomitable will.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: A man is but the product of his thoughts. What he thinks, he becomes.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Gratitude can transform common days into thanksgivings, turn routine jobs into joy, and change ordinary opportunities into blessings.
author: William Arthur Ward

text: It is very important to know who you are. To make decisions. To show who you are.
author: Malala Yousafzai

text: When you fail you learn from the mistakes you made and it motivates you to work even harder.
author: Natalie Gulbis

text: You have to learn the rules of the game. And then you have to play better than anyone else.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Success is the only motivational factor that a boy with character needs.
author: Woody Hayes

text: I really believe that everyone has a talent, ability, or skill that he can mine to support himself and to succeed in life.
author: Dean Koontz

text: There is progress whether you are going forward or backward. The thing is to move!
author: Edgar Cayce

text: How do you know you’re going to do something, until you do it?
author: J. D. Salinger

text: Your heaviest artillery will be your will to live. Keep that big gun going.
author: Norman Cousins

text: Set yourself earnestly to see what you are made to do, and then set yourself earnestly to do it.
author: Phillips Brooks

text: Don’t give up. Don’t lose hope. Don’t sell out.
author: Christopher Reeve

text: To be wholly devoted to some intellectual exercise is to have succeeded in life.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

text: Be thankful for what you have; you’ll end up having more. If you concentrate on what you don’t have, you will never, ever have enough.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: I am grateful for what I am and have. My thanksgiving is perpetual.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Even though we’re a week and a half away from Thanksgiving, it’s beginning to look a lot like Christmas.
author: Richard Roeper

text: Gratitude is the inward feeling of kindness received. Thankfulness is the natural impulse to express that feeling. Thanksgiving is the following of that impulse.
author: Henry Van Dyke

text: I love Thanksgiving because it’s a holiday that is centered around food and family, two things that are of utmost importance to me.
author: Marcus Samuelsson

text: If a fellow isn’t thankful for what he’s got, he isn’t likely to be thankful for what he’s going to get.
author: Frank A. Clark

text: Thanksgiving just gets me all warm and tingly and all kinds of wonderful inside.
author: Willard Scott

text: Thanksgiving is one of my favorite days of the year because it reminds us to give thanks and to count our blessings. Suddenly, so many things become so little when we realize how blessed and lucky we are.
author: Joyce Giraud

text: There is no racial or ethnic involvement in Thanksgiving, and people who may be very distant from the Christian system can see the beauty and the positive spirit that comes from the holiday.
author: John Clayton

text: Tell me and I forget. Teach me and I remember. Involve me and I learn.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: We are all born ignorant, but one must work hard to remain stupid.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Without continual growth and progress, such words as improvement, achievement, and success have no meaning.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Early to bed and early to rise makes a man healthy, wealthy and wise.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Money has never made man happy, nor will it, there is nothing in its nature to produce happiness. The more of it one has the more one wants.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Any fool can criticize, condemn and complain — and most fools do.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: There is always some madness in love. But there is also always some reason in madness.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: We love life, not because we are used to living but because we are used to loving.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: To live is to suffer, to survive is to find some meaning in the suffering.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Whoever fights monsters should see to it that in the process he does not become a monster. And if you gaze long enough into an abyss, the abyss will gaze back into you.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Thoughts are the shadows of our feelings—always darker, emptier and simpler.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: All things are subject to interpretation. Whichever interpretation prevails at a given time is a function of power and not truth.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: That which does not kill us makes us stronger.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Those who cannot understand how to put their thoughts on ice should not enter into the heat of debate.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: On the mountains of truth you can never climb in vain: either you will reach a point higher up today, or you will be training your powers so that you will be able to climb higher tomorrow.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: God gave us the gift of life; it is up to us to give ourselves the gift of living well.
author: Voltaire

text: Appreciation is a wonderful thing: It makes what is excellent in others belong to us as well.
author: Voltaire

text: Those who can make you believe absurdities can make you commit atrocities.
author: Voltaire

text: Think for yourselves and let others enjoy the privilege to do so, too.
author: Voltaire

text: No problem can withstand the assault of sustained thinking.
author: Voltaire

text: It is not sufficient to see and to know the beauty of a work. We must feel and be affected by it.
author: Voltaire

text: Perfection is attained by slow degrees; it requires the hand of time.
author: Voltaire

text: Paradise was made for tender hearts; hell, for loveless hearts.
author: Voltaire

text: Each player must accept the cards life deals him or her: but once they are in hand, he or she alone must decide how to play the cards in order to win the game.
author: Voltaire

text: Christmas is the spirit of giving without a thought of getting. It is happiness because we see joy in people. It is forgetting self and finding time for others. It is discarding the meaningless and stressing the true values.
author: Thomas S. Monson

text: Christmas waves a magic wand over this world, and behold, everything is softer and more beautiful.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

text: He who has not Christmas in his heart will never find it under a tree.
author: Roy L. Smith

text: Christmas is not a time nor a season, but a state of mind. To cherish peace and goodwill, to be plenteous in mercy, is to have the real spirit of Christmas.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: Christmas gives us the opportunity to pause and reflect on the important things around us—a time when we can look back on the year that has passed and prepare for the year ahead.
author: David Cameron

text: God never gives someone a gift they are not capable of receiving. If he gives us the gift of Christmas, it is because we all have the ability to understand and receive it.
author: Pope Francis

text: Happy, happy Christmas, that can win us back to the delusions of our childhood days, recall to the old man the pleasures of his youth, and transport the traveler back to his own fireside and quiet home!
author: Charles Dickens

text: When you look back on all the Christmases in your life, you’ll find you’ve created family traditions and lasting memories. Those memories, good and bad, are really what help to keep a family together over the long haul.
author: Caroline Kennedy

text: One of the most glorious messes in the world is the mess created in the living room on Christmas day. Don’t clean it up too quickly.
author: Andy Rooney

text: Christmas is far and away my favorite holiday. I love everything about it, from the event that inspired it, hoping for a white one, to wrapping presents. But mostly I love having family and friends gathered, and sharing traditions.
author: Ellen Hopkins

text: At Christmas play and make good cheer, for Christmas comes but once a year.
author: Thomas Tusser

text: Once again, we come to the Holiday Season, a deeply religious time that each of us observes, in his own way, by going to the mall of his choice.
author: Dave Barry

text: Christmas is a tonic for our souls. It moves us to think of others rather than of ourselves. It directs our thoughts to giving.
author: B. C. Forbes

text: The main reason Santa is so jolly is because he knows where all the bad girls live.
author: George Carlin

text: Christmas and the holidays are the season of giving. It’s a time when people are more kind and open-hearted.
author: Gisele Bundchen

text: When you give up yourself, that’s when you will feel the true spirit of Christmas. And that’s giving that’s serving others and that’s when you feel fulfilled.
author: Joel Osteen

text: Christmas is a season for kindling the fire for hospitality in the hall, the genial flame of charity in the heart.
author: Washington Irving

text: I love the excitement, the childlike spirit of innocence and just about everything that goes along with Christmas.
author: Hillary Scott

text: Throughout history, Hanukkah was a relatively minor festival, but it’s become very popular in America due to its proximity to Christmas.
author: Gil Marks

text:
On Hanukkah, the first dark night,
Light yourself a candle bright.
I’ll you, if you will me invite
To dance within that gentle light.
author: Nick Gordon

text: I love Hanukkah because it’s so weird. You just sit there and light candles and say spells.
author: King Tuff

text: Let me make a Hanukkah song that kids can listen to, party to and get the spirituality of it, because it is not just about dreidels and having fun.
author: Matisyahu

text: A thousand candles can be lit from the flame of one candle, and the life of the candle will not be shortened. Happiness can be spread without diminishing that of yourself.
author: Buddha

text: The love of family and the admiration of friends is much more important than wealth and privilege.
author: Charles Kuralt

text: Positive feelings come from being honest about yourself and accepting your personality, and physical characteristics, warts and all; and, from belonging to a family that accepts you without question.
author: Willard Scott

text: The only rock I know that stays steady, the only institution I know that works, is the family.
author: Lee Iacocca

text: My family is everything. I am what I am thanks to my mother, my father, my brother, my sister… because they have given me everything. The education I have is thanks to them.
author: Ronaldinho

text: I love spending time with my friends and family. The simplest things in life give me the most pleasure: cooking a good meal, enjoying my friends.
author: Cindy Morgan

text: I wanted to say thanks… and share my gratitude for everything I’ve been blessed with. Family, friends, and continued support from everyone.
author: Travis Barker

text: I’m surrounded by great friends and family. I don’t know what I would do without them.
author: Emma Roberts

text: The most important thing in the world is family and love.
author: John Wooden

text:
For last year’s words belong to last year’s language
And next year’s words await another voice.
And to make an end is to make a beginning.
author: T.S. Eliot

text: Tomorrow, is the first blank page of a 365 page book. Write a good one.
author: Brad Paisley

text: Departure of a year welcomes so many new memories.
author: Munia Khan

text: New Year—a new chapter, new verse, or just the same old story? Ultimately we write it. The choice is ours.
author: Alex Morritt

text: In the depth of winter I finally learned that there was in me an invincible summer.
author: Albert Camus

text: People don’t notice whether it’s winter or summer when they’re happy.
author: Anton Chekhov

text: If we had no winter, the spring would not be so pleasant: if we did not sometimes taste of adversity, prosperity would not be so welcome.
author: Anne Bradstreet

text: He who marvels at the beauty of the world in summer will find equal cause for wonder and admiration in winter.
author: John Burroughs

text: While I relish our warm months, winter forms our character and brings out our best.
author: Tom Allen

text: It is the life of the crystal, the architect of the flake, the fire of the frost, the soul of the sunbeam. This crisp winter air is full of it.
author: John Burroughs

text: Never cut a tree down in the wintertime. Never make a negative decision in the low time. Never make your most important decisions when you are in your worst moods. Wait. Be patient. The storm will pass. The spring will come.
author: Robert H. Schuller

text: The spring of love becomes hidden and soon filled up.
author: Max Muller

text: Spring is proof that there is beauty in new beginnings.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo

text: You can cut all the flowers but you cannot keep spring from coming.
author: Pablo Neruda

text: In the spring, at the end of the day, you should smell like dirt.
author: Margaret Atwood

text: The beautiful spring came; and when Nature resumes her loveliness, the human soul is apt to revive also.
author: Harriet Ann Jacobs

text: I am going to look around at all the flowers, and look up at the hectic trees. I am going to close my eyes and listen.
author: Anne Lamott

text: It is only the farmer who faithfully plants seeds in the Spring, who reaps a harvest in the Autumn.
author: B. C. Forbes

text: Fall gives us a premonition of winter, but then, winter, will be forced to relent, once again, to the new beginnings of soft greens, longer light, and the sweet air of spring.
author: Madeleine M. Kunin

text: Deep summer is when laziness finds respectability.
author: Sam Keen

text: There is no real need for decorations when throwing a barbecue party—let the summer garden, in all its vibrant and luscious splendour, speak for itself.
author: Pippa Middleton

text: What good is the warmth of summer, without the cold of winter to give it sweetness.
author: John Steinbeck

text: Summer afternoon; to me those have always been the two most beautiful words in the English language.
author: Henry James

text: The moon is at her full, and riding high, floods the calm fields with light. The airs that hover in the summer sky are all asleep tonight.
author: William C. Bryant

text: There is a time in the last few days of summer when the ripeness of autumn fills the air.
author: Rudolfo Anaya

text: Summer ends, and autumn comes, and he who would have it otherwise would have high tide always and a full moon every night.
author: Hal Borland

text: Autumn is a second spring when every leaf is a flower.
author: Albert Camus

text: Autumn wins you best by this its mute appeal to sympathy for its decay.
author: Robert Browning

text: Autumn’s fire burns slowly along the woods and day by day the dead leaves fall and melt.
author: William Allingham

text: No man can taste the fruits of autumn while he is delighting his scent with the flowers of spring.
author: Samuel Johnson

text: It looked like the world was covered in a cobbler crust of brown sugar and cinnamon.
author: Sarah Addison Allen

text: Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic.
author: Arthur C. Clarke

text: The only way of discovering the limits of the possible is to venture a little way past them into the impossible.
author: Arthur C. Clarke

text: You never change things by fighting the existing reality. To change something, build a new model that makes the existing model obsolete.
author: R. Buckminster Fuller

text: We are stuck with technology when what we really want is just stuff that works.
author: Douglas Adams

text: Computers are useless. They can only give you answers.
author: Pablo Picasso

text: Technological progress has merely provided us with more efficient means for going backwards.
author: Aldous Huxley

text: Even the technology that promises to unite us, divides us. Each of us is now electronically connected to the globe, and yet we feel utterly alone.
author: Dan Brown

text: The Internet is the Petri dish of humanity. We can’t control what grows in it, but we don’t have to watch either.
author: Tiffany Madison

text: Technology is the knack of so arranging the world that we do not experience it.
author: Rollo May

text: It doesn’t stop being magic just because you know how it works.
author: Terry Pratchett

text: Be a surfer. Watch the ocean. Figure out where the big waves are breaking and adjust accordingly.
author: Jason Fried and Heinemeier David Hansson

text: We’ve arranged a civilization in which most crucial elements profoundly depend on science and technology. We have also arranged things so that almost no one understands science and technology. This is a prescription for disaster.
author: Carl Sagan

text: Somewhere, something incredible is waiting to be known.
author: Carl Sagan

text: Technology is just a tool. In terms of getting the kids working together and motivating them, the teacher is the most important.
author: Bill Gates

text: Man is a slow, sloppy, and brilliant thinker; computers are fast, accurate, and stupid.
author: John Pfeiffer

text: Some of the greatest discoveries consist mainly in the clearing away of psychological roadblocks which obstruct the approach to reality; which is why, post factum, they appear so obvious.
author: Arthur Koestler

text: What a computer is to me is the most remarkable tool that we have ever come up with. It’s the equivalent of a bicycle for our minds.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Anyone who lives within their means suffers from a lack of imagination.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Sometimes life’s going to hit you in the head with a brick. Don’t lose faith. I’m convinced that the only thing that kept me going was that I loved what I did.
author: Steve Jobs

text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do. If you haven’t found it yet, keep looking. Don’t settle.
author: Steve Jobs

text: If you wish to make an apple pie from scratch, you must first invent the universe.
author: Carl Sagan

text: An expert is a person who has made all the mistakes that can be made in a very narrow field.
author: Niels Bohr

text: We can judge our progress by the courage of our questions and the depth of our answers, our willingness to embrace what is true rather than what feels good.
author: Carl Sagan

text: I’m sure the universe is full of intelligent life. It’s just been too intelligent to come here.
author: Arthur C. Clarke

text: One glance at a book and you hear the voice of another person, perhaps someone dead for 1,000 years. To read is to voyage through time.
author: Carl Sagan

text: If you would tell me the heart of a man, tell me not what he reads, but what he rereads.
author: François Mauriac

text: All that mankind has done, thought, gained, or been; it is lying as in magic preservation in the pages of books.
author: Thomas Carlyle

text: The more that you read, the more things you will know. The more that you learn, the more places you’ll go.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: We’re so busy watching out for what’s just ahead of us that we don’t take time to enjoy where we are.
author: Bill Watterson

text: Yesterday is dead, tomorrow hasn’t arrived yet. I have just one day, and I’m going to be happy in it.
author: Groucho Marx

text: I’m killing time while I wait for life to shower me with meaning and happiness.
author: Bill Watterson

text: The secret of life is honesty and fair dealing. If you can fake that, you’ve got it made.
author: Groucho Marx

text: In my opinion, we don’t devote nearly enough scientific research to finding a cure for jerks.
author: Bill Watterson

text: If you try and take a cat apart to see how it works, the first thing you have on your hands is a non-working cat.
author: Douglas Adams

text: Outside of a dog, a book is man’s best friend. Inside of a dog it’s too dark to read.
author: Groucho Marx

text: There’s one way to find out if a man is honest—ask him. If he says “yes” you know he is a crook.
author: Groucho Marx

text: If at first you don’t succeed then skydiving definitely isn’t for you.
author: Steven Wright

text: Coffee. The sweet balm by which we shall accomplish today’s tasks.
author: Holly Black

text: Study hard what interests you the most in the most undisciplined, irreverent and original manner possible
author: Richard Feynman

text: We are, as a species, addicted to story. Even when the body goes to sleep, the mind stays up all night, telling itself stories.
author: Jonathan Gottschall

text: Bear the pain of detachment and you will find inner peace.
author: Rumi

text: Real giving is when we give to our spouses what’s important to them, whether we understand it, like it, agree with it, or not.
author: Michele Weiner-Davis

text: The desire of the man is for the woman, but the desire of the woman is for the desire of the man.
author: Madame de Stael

text: Don’t let perfection become procrastination. Do it now.
author: Danielle LaPorte

text: We cannot teach people anything. We can only help them discover it within themselves.
author: Galileo Galilei

text: Our most basic common link is that we all inhabit this planet. We all breathe the same air. We all cherish our children’s future. And we are all mortal.
author: John F. Kennedy

text: If you only walk on sunny days you’ll never reach your destination.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: It is the struggle toward an ideal, the constant effort to get higher and further, which develops manhood and character.
author: James Terry White

text: Sometimes it falls on a generation to be great. You can be that great generation. Let your greatness blossom.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: We can complain because rose bushes have thorns, or rejoice because thorn bushes have roses.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: You can not change what you refuse to confront.
author: John Spence

text: Books don’t offer real escape, but they can stop a mind scratching itself raw.
author: David Mitchell

text: Success is liking yourself, liking what you do, and liking how you do it.
author: Maya Angelou

text: I don’t want to be at the mercy of my emotions. I want to use them, to enjoy them, and to dominate them.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Once a year, go someplace you’ve never been before.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.
author: Thomas Edison

text: Coming together is a beginning; keeping together is progress; working together is success.
author: Henry Ford

text: A business that makes nothing but money is a poor business.
author: Henry Ford

text: You have to be burning with an idea, or a problem, or a wrong that you want to right.
author: Steve Jobs

text: There’s no luck in business. There’s only drive, determination, and more drive.
author: Sophie Kinsella

text: There are no secrets to success. It is the result of preparation, hard work, and learning from failure.
author: Colin Powell

text: Great things in business are never done by one person. They’re done by a team of people.
author: Steve Jobs

text: In the business world, the rearview mirror is always clearer than the windshield.
author: Warren Buffett

text: The most potent muse of all is our own inner child.
author: Stephen Nachmanovitch

text: Never be in a hurry; do everything quietly and in a calm spirit. Do not lose your inner peace for anything whatsoever, even if your whole world seems upset.
author: Saint Francis de Sales

text: A friend is what the heart needs all the time.
author: Henry Van Dyke

text: The work of art is to dominate the spectator. The spectator is not to dominate the work of art.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: I learned to give not because I have much, but because I know exactly how it feels to have nothing.
author: Anonymous

text: Over time, the hurt doesn’t hurt. Only regret does.
author: Terri Guillemets

text: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: See the world. It’s more fantastic than any dream made or paid for in factories. Ask for no guarantees, ask for no security.
author: Ray Bradbury

text: Human beings, who are almost unique in having the ability to learn from the experience of others, are also remarkable for their apparent disinclination to do so.
author: Douglas Adams

text: At the touch of love everyone becomes a poet.
author: Plato

text: It is not joy that makes us grateful. It is gratitude that makes us joyful.
author: David Steindl-Rast

text: Every single person has at least one secret that would break your heart. If we could just remember this, I think there would be a lot more compassion and tolerance in the world.
author: Frank Warren

text: The world has become so serious that humor is a risky profession.
author: Bernardo Erlich

text: The best part of my life is who I share it with.
author: Anonymous

text: I will not let anyone walk through my mind with their dirty feet.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Unless you try to do something beyond what you have already mastered you will never grow.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: If you have time to whine and complain about something then you have the time to do something about it.
author: Anthony J. D’Angelo

text: Anything I’ve done that was ultimately worthwhile initially scared me to death.
author: Betty Bender

text: It is better to fail in originality than to succeed in imitation.
author: Herman Melville

text: Success consists of going from failure to failure without loss of enthusiasm.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Our knowledge has made us cynical; our cleverness, hard and unkind. We think too much and feel too little. More than machinery, we need humanity. More than cleverness, we need kindness and gentleness.
author: Charlie Chaplin

text: The very essence of romance is uncertainty.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: True love is rare, and it’s the only thing that gives life real meaning.
author: Nicholas Sparks

text: I was smiling yesterday, I am smiling today and I will smile tomorrow. Simply because life is too short to cry for anything.
author: Santosh Kalwar

text: He took her in his arms and kissed her under the sunlit sky, and he cared not that they stood high upon the walls in the sight of many.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Romance is the glamour which turns the dust of everyday life into a golden haze.
author: Elinor Glyn

text:
If music be the food of love, play on,
Give me excess of it; that surfeiting,
The appetite may sicken, and so die.
author: William Shakespeare

text: If you love somebody, let them go, for if they return, they were always yours. If they don’t, they never were.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: The Very first moment I beheld him, my heart was irrevocably gone.
author: Jane Austen

text: When one is in love, one always begins by deceiving one’s self, and one always ends by deceiving others. That is what the world calls a romance.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Never close your lips to those whom you have already opened your heart.
author: Charles Dickens

text: In our time together, you claimed a special place in my heart, one I’ll carry with me forever and that no one can ever replace.
author: Nicholas Sparks

text: Romance is thinking about your significant other, when you are supposed to be thinking about something else.
author: Nicholas Sparks

text: Love is a great emotion, but I believe it’s not just about romance; it could be love for nature, people, for relationships.
author: Rani Mukerji

text: In a great romance, each person basically plays a part that the other really likes.
author: Elizabeth Ashley

text: First be faithful to each other. Second, keep the romance going all of your life by courting each other every day.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: Money can buy you a fine dog, but only love can make him wag his tail.
author: Kinky Friedman

text: They invented hugs to let people know you love them without saying anything.
author: Bil Keane

text: If at first you don’t succeed, try, try again. Then quit. No use being a damn fool about it.
author: W.C. Fields

text: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: If you want to leave footprints in the sands of time, don’t drag your feet.
author: Arnot L. Sheppard

text: We should not judge people by their peak of excellence; but by the distance they have traveled from the point where they started.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

text: Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off your goal.
author: Henry Ford

text: Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect.
author: Mark Twain

text: The pessimist complains about the wind; the optimist expects it to change; the realist adjusts the sails.
author: William Arthur Ward

text: The less you talk, the more you’re listened to.
author: Abigail Van Buren

text: Ignorant men raise questions that wise men answered a thousand years ago.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
author: Aristotle

text: The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom.
author: Isaac Asimov

text: Nothing is more dangerous than an idea, when it’s the only one we have.
author: Alain

text: It’s better to be a lion for a day than a sheep all your life.
author: Elizabeth Kenny

text: Think before you speak. Read before you think.
author: Fran Lebowitz

text: The best index to a person’s character is how he treats people who can’t do him any good, and how he treats people who can’t fight back.
author: Abigail Van Buren

text: Do not seek to follow in the footsteps of the wise. Seek what they sought.
author: Matsuo Basho

text: It is the province of knowledge to speak, and it is the privilege of wisdom to listen.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

text: A man begins cutting his wisdom teeth the first time he bites off more than he can chew.
author: Herb Caen

text: The young man knows the rules, but the old man knows the exceptions.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

text: When you choose to see the good in others, you end up finding the good in yourself.
author: John Spence

text: Nature gave men two ends — one to sit on and one to think with. Ever since then man’s success or failure has been dependent on the one he used most.
author: George Ross Kirkpatrick

text: Humility is not thinking less of yourself, it’s thinking of yourself less.
author: C. S. Lewis

text: Even when we are quite alone, how often do we think with pleasure or pain of what others think of us — of their imagined approbation or disapprobation.
author: Charles Darwin
